br.com.caelum.vraptor

Interface Validator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractValidator, DefaultValidator, JSR303MockValidator, MockValidator

    public interface Validator
    A validator interface for vraptor3.
    Based on hamcrest, it allows you to assert for specific situations.
    Author:
    Guilherme Silveira

    • Method Detail

      • checking

        void checking(Validations rules)

      • validate

        void validate(java.lang.Object object,
            java.lang.Class<?>... groups)
        Validate an object using some Bean Validation engine. If the object is null, the validation will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be validated.
        groups - The groups to be validated.
        Since:
        vraptor3.1.2

      • validateProperties

        void validateProperties(java.lang.Object object,
                      java.lang.String... properties)
        Validate the specifics propeties of an object using some Bean Validation engine. If the object is null, the validation will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be validated.
        properties - The names of properties to be validated.

      • onErrorForwardTo

        <T> T onErrorForwardTo(java.lang.Class<T> controller)
        Shortcut for 
        onErrorUse(logic()).forwardTo(controller);

      • onErrorForwardTo

        <T> T onErrorForwardTo(T controller)
        Shortcut for 
        onErrorUse(logic()).forwardTo(controller.getClass());
        For usage in the same controller:
        validator.onErrorForwardTo(this).someLogic();

      • onErrorRedirectTo

        <T> T onErrorRedirectTo(java.lang.Class<T> controller)
        Shortcut for 
        onErrorUse(logic()).redirectTo(controller);

      • onErrorRedirectTo

        <T> T onErrorRedirectTo(T controller)
        Shortcut for 
        onErrorUse(logic()).redirectTo(controller.getClass());
        For usage in the same controller:
        validator.onErrorRedirectTo(this).someLogic();

      • onErrorUsePageOf

        <T> T onErrorUsePageOf(java.lang.Class<T> controller)
        Shortcut for 
        onErrorUse(page()).of(controller);

      • onErrorUsePageOf

        <T> T onErrorUsePageOf(T controller)
        Shortcut for 
        onErrorUse(page()).of(controller.getClass());
        For usage in the same controller:
        validator.onErrorUsePageOf(this).someLogic();

      • onErrorSendBadRequest

        void onErrorSendBadRequest()
        Shortcut for 
        onErrorUse(status()).badRequest(errors);
        the actual validation errors list will be used.
